programme.title: Ovo malo duse
Ovo malo duše
programme.desc: Ovo malo duse: Directed by Ademir Kenovic. With Branko Djuric, Boro Stjepanovic, Zaim Muzaferija, Sasa Petrovic. A bitter coming-of-age story about boy who grows up in a remote Bosnian village shortly after the WW II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0279213/","name":"Ovo malo duse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyNTVjNDYtMDM3OC00ZTMzLTk0MzAtZDgwNTg1NjQxOWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1NDIxMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bitter coming-of-age story about boy who grows up in a remote Bosnian village shortly after the WW II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0279213/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"requiem-8"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"The devil gave a man this little bit of soul to make him suffer.","reviewBody":"In a small Bosnian village, a young boy is facing the hardness of a poor life, the death of his mother and the abrupt ending of his youth. This Drama shows a Muslim boy preparing for a traditional wedding to fulfill his mothers last wish. He follows the traditions in order to become a man. Ordinary happenings, funny and sad at the same time, full of nostalgia for something so close, but still, far far away. This is the first feature movie of the director Ademir Kenovic. It shows the traditional way of life in post WW2 Bosnia. Its hard not to like this movie, especially for people who are conscious about the hardness of reality.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":691,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1987-02-16","keywords":"railway,village,bosnia,yugoslavia","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0229301/","name":"Branko Djuric"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830655/","name":"Boro Stjepanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0616225/","name":"Zaim Muzaferija"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0448632/","name":"Ademir Kenovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050591/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057374/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102492/","name":"Ranko Bozic"}],"duration":"PT1H18M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zemaljski dani teku
Zemaljski dani teku
programme.desc: Zemaljski dani teku: Directed by Goran Paskaljevic. With Dimitrije Vujovic, Obren Helcer, Sarlota Pesic, Mila Keca. An old sea captain has lived on his own as long as he has been able to. Between his pension and the portraits he paints for a little spending money, he has done all right. However, the day finally comes when he must enter an old age home. Nothing daunted, his high spirits and zest for living infect the whole home with enthusiasm as they prepare a New Year's Eve party for visiting relatives. Even the captain's withdrawn and sour old roommate at the home eventually joins in." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0174353/","name":"Zemaljski dani teku","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmE4ZmJhNjktYTQ4My00Y2QyLTk3MDUtYTMyZjk4OGNlMzY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","description":"An old sea captain has lived on his own as long as he has been able to. Angel and the Devil fight for the soul of a Belgrade rocker, that he can't survive in the body of an old punker." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0820117/","name":"A3 - Rock'n'Roll uzvraca udarac","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWY1YTFiNWMtZmRlMC00NWE1LTk1YzQtMTJiNTg1ZWU1N2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTgxOTUwMTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Angel and the Devil fight for the soul of a Belgrade rocker, that he can't survive in the body of an old punker.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0820117/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Alternative-rocker"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"awesome movie","reviewBody":"This is an awesome movie and anyone who doesn't think so is either dumb or doesn't understand Serbian humor. Everyone says that the first part was the best but i think that this one is. It's a comedy about musicians and it has everything a comedy should have. You just have to understand the way Serbian people think. You can't say it's a bad movie if you didn't grow up watching and listening to this kind of stuff. Don't get me wrong . I'm not saying that you have to be Serbian in order to understand this movie. This is a movie for the whole world and i recommend it to everyone. programme.title: Dogodilo se na danasnji dan
Dogodilo se na današnji dan
programme.desc:
Dogodilo se na danasnji dan: Directed by Miroslav Lekic. With Zarko Lausevic, Srdjan 'Zika' Todorovic, Olja Beckovic, Nebojsa Bakocevic. Belgrade in 1963. In a yard surrounded by buildings, a group of young people of different backgrounds and social status, but of similar views about love and self-affirmation, spend their time together. Their friendship is dyed with various events typical for socialism, such as working actions or Youth Day's parade. All what happens within this yard may become an allegory of one generation's destiny." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0181498/","name":"Dogodilo se na danasnji dan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2I3Nzc3YmMtZGIzNS00YWUwLTg5Y2QtMjY5ODllNjM2Mzg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc0MTYwMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Belgrade in 1963. Laugh and a seriosity. It has been so many times on TV, I don t know, I think many, many filmofils have watched it.

The great actors, for some of them one of the first movies. The people from ex - Yugoslavia know when hear: Zarko Lausevic, Srdjan Todorovic, Zoran Cvijanovic, Vesna Trivalic, etc that it is quality film.

You will laugh, focus on Srdjan Todorovic ( Males ),

but it isn t a comedy, at the end of the movie, you get serious! A Belgrade neighbourhood: the main characters are 18 - 25 years old, young people. Growing up, love problems,social problems... 

A realistic story, the 70-es in Belgrade...

I strongly recommend it! programme.title: Ovo malo duse
Ovo malo duše
programme.desc: Ovo malo duse: Directed by Ademir Kenovic. With Branko Djuric, Boro Stjepanovic, Zaim Muzaferija, Sasa Petrovic. A bitter coming-of-age story about boy who grows up in a remote Bosnian village shortly after the WW II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0279213/","name":"Ovo malo duse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyNTVjNDYtMDM3OC00ZTMzLTk0MzAtZDgwNTg1NjQxOWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1NDIxMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bitter coming-of-age story about boy who grows up in a remote Bosnian village shortly after the WW II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0279213/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"requiem-8"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"The devil gave a man this little bit of soul to make him suffer.","reviewBody":"In a small Bosnian village, a young boy is facing the hardness of a poor life, the death of his mother and the abrupt ending of his youth. This Drama shows a Muslim boy preparing for a traditional wedding to fulfill his mothers last wish. He follows the traditions in order to become a man. Ordinary happenings, funny and sad at the same time, full of nostalgia for something so close, but still, far far away. This is the first feature movie of the director Ademir Kenovic. It shows the traditional way of life in post WW2 Bosnia. Its hard not to like this movie, especially for people who are conscious about the hardness of reality.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":691,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1987-02-16","keywords":"railway,village,bosnia,yugoslavia","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0229301/","name":"Branko Djuric"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830655/","name":"Boro Stjepanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0616225/","name":"Zaim Muzaferija"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0448632/","name":"Ademir Kenovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050591/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057374/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102492/","name":"Ranko Bozic"}],"duration":"PT1H18M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zemaljski dani teku
Zemaljski dani teku
programme.desc: Zemaljski dani teku: Directed by Goran Paskaljevic. With Dimitrije Vujovic, Obren Helcer, Sarlota Pesic, Mila Keca. An old sea captain has lived on his own as long as he has been able to. Between his pension and the portraits he paints for a little spending money, he has done all right. However, the day finally comes when he must enter an old age home. Nothing daunted, his high spirits and zest for living infect the whole home with enthusiasm as they prepare a New Year's Eve party for visiting relatives. programme.title: Nacionalna klasa
Nacionalna klasa
programme.desc:
Nacionalna klasa: Directed by Goran Markovic. With Dragan Nikolic, Bogdan Diklic, Gorica Popovic, Rade Markovic. One week in a life of Branimir Mitrovic "Floyd", a young rally driver from the National Class (up to 785cc), dreaming of promotion to the higher category. He lives a carefree life of a Belgrade dandy boy, neglecting his girlfriend, avoiding his draft calls, and refusing to deal with any life responsibility in general. The decisive race on Saturday is only what he cares about." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0079606/","name":"Nacionalna klasa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWQ3ZTFkYWItNTIxNC00ZGJlLTgyZWUtZmViNTgyNzRiNmE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","description":"One week in a life of Branimir Mitrovic "Floyd", a young rally driver from the National Class (up to 785cc), dreaming of promotion to the higher category. He lives a carefree life of a Belgrade dandy boy, neglecting his girlfriend, a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079606/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Decko_koji_obecava"},"dateCreated":"2002-07-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very enjoyable","reviewBody":"This film should be an example to young Serbian directors of today (Raso Andricu, are you listening) on how to make a quality light, youth-oriented movie.

"Nacionalna klasa" is basically about a young man's reluctance to grow up. It stars Dragan Nikolic as Brana Mitrovic a.k.a. Floyd, a part-time race car driver and full-time freeloader. He's 27, still living with his parents and gives an impression of someone who hasn't put in too many hard working days in his life. Movie follows him through 7 key days of his life during which he:


* tries to weasel out of mandatory military service by faking a kidney disease, 



* frantically looks for money to buy new tires for his Zastava Fiat as he's got a big race on the weekend, 



* is informed by his girlfriend Vukosava a.k.a. Silja (Gorica Popovic) with whom he maintains a very casual relationship that she's pregnant with his kid and wants to break up, etc, etc...


Movie introduces a bunch of supporting characters too, of whom the most memorable are Mile rent-a-bubreg (Bogdan Diklic) and an eternal film student (played by Aleksandar Bercek) at the Faculty of Dramatic Arts who seems to have it in for famous Spanish surrealist director Luis Bunuel. The right ratio of comedy vs. poignancy is maintained throughout, as to avoid the movie becoming either too frivolous or too preachy.

Will our flawed hero finally become a responsible adult or will he continue his womanizing, mooching and free-spending ways? Well, the movie doesn't say since this is not the kind of major transformation that happens over such a short period but by the end of the flick Floyd definitely doesn't look a care-free guy he did in the beginning of it.

As an aside, it is interesting to watch mid-to-late 1970s Belgrade in the background. This was a definite heyday of the communist, foreign-loan-fueled la dolce vita in Yugoslavia. National basketball team was winning European, World and Olympic titles, people were going to Trieste, Italy on weekend shopping pilgrimages in search of fashionable western merchandise and Goran Bregovic & 'Bijelo dugme' were introducing the mass appeal of rock'n'roll to Yugoslav youth. Unfortunately it didn't last, a slow but steady downhill ride commenced soon afterwards, culminating in what the entire world saw play out in the Balkans during the 1990s."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3581,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"1979-01-09","keywords":"driver,rain,on the run,mud,male female relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631877/","name":"Dragan Nikolic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0226699/","name":"Bogdan Diklic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691419/","name":"Gorica Popovic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Virdzina
Virdžina
programme.desc: Virdzina: Directed by Srdjan Karanovic. With Miodrag Krivokapic, Marta Keler, Inka Gogálová, Igor Bjelan. "Virgina" tells a tale from the end of the 19th century. It took place in a isolated village near the Adriatic Sea. Because of the extreme patriarchal culture there is a superstition that families without male heirs are cursed. When the wife of a farmer gives birth to their fourth daughter, father decides that the child will become a so-called "Virgina" and that she will live as a man, so that she can work and be the family heir. This heartbreaking story of Virgina's life is told with strong words, augmented with harsh environment." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105761/","name":"Virdzina","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODVmNDc3ZTUtZDk3Ny00MjJjLWE5ZjgtMjJjMTU1MzZmY2U4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","description":""Virgina" tells a tale from the end of the 19th century. It took place in a isolated village near the Adriatic Sea. Because of the extreme patriarchal culture there is a superstition that families without male heirs are cursed. When ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105761/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"itends-here"},"dateCreated":"2010-12-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amazing film","reviewBody":"The idea of this film is quite original and intriguing. I watched it for the first time about a year ago and I now consider it one of my favourite films of all time. As an English speaker, the Serbian dialogue/necessity of subtitles did not take anything from my enjoyment, as it added to the otherworldly, minimalistic atmosphere. After being flooded with Hollywood sensationalism, a film like this is extremely refreshing- dramatic but not melodramatic. It is honest and beautiful. The focus is on the internal and external struggles of the characters instead of action and visual effects. I found myself brought to tears by the plight of the protagonist; I would recommend this to anyone who likes foreign films, GLBT films (as it shows a different aspect of gender identity), or "slow", thoughtful dramas.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":507,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1991-04-05","keywords":"superstition,village,farmer,sexual identity,gender confusion","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0471771/","name":"Miodrag Krivokapic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445447/","name":"Marta Keler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0324632/","name":"Inka Gogálová"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438906/","name":"Srdjan Karanovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016788/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065791/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438906/","name":"Srdjan Karanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0547719/","name":"Milosav Marinovic"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dnevnik uvreda 1993

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
Paklene ulice 2
programme.desc: 2 Fast 2 Furious: Directed by John Singleton. With Paul Walker, Tyrese Gibson, Eva Mendes, Cole Hauser. Former cop Brian O'Conner is called upon to bust a dangerous criminal and he recruits the help of a former childhood friend and street racer who has a chance to redeem himself." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0322259/","name":"2 Fast 2 Furious","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzExYjcyYWMtY2JkOC00NDUwLTg2OTgtMDI3MGY2OWQzMDE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Former cop Brian O'Conner is called upon to bust a dangerous criminal and he recruits the help of a former childhood friend and street racer who has a chance to redeem himself.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0322259/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"daniel_velker"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"2 times the fast 2 times the furious but still not better than the original.","reviewBody":"This film brings back more of what we loved from the first film with all the cars, girls, and action and multiplies it. However it is still inferior to the first film but that dosen't mean it isn't awesome. This movie has gotten a lot of criticism and i don't understand why there is so much hate for this movie. Some people complained about the lack of plot and the casts acting skills but I don't care about that. I watch these Fast films to be entertained and I was throughly entertained with this one. Even though it dosen't match up to the original it still excels in excitement. I mean how could you go wrong with taking the series to Miami were our eyes will be blessed with dozens of beautiful beach girls. And the races in this movie are also very exciting to. And let's not forget the awesome chase sequence in the film as well. Paul Walker and Tyrese Gibson make a great team and show us why this movie is so cool. I still love this movie despite the many negative reviews I've seen and to all the haters I say forget about the plot and just enjoy the perks. This movie is made for entertainment not Oscar awards and as far as entertainment goes It was grade A popcorn style."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":265332,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2003-06-06","keywords":"undercover agent,racing,miami florida,sequel,motor vehicle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"2 Fast 2 Furious","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2897412377","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDIyZWUxZjgtMTA1ZC00YWQxLTg1NWMtMGI5MjBkMGE0MzRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDIyZWUxZjgtMTA1ZC00YWQxLTg1NWMtMGI5MjBkMGE0MzRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0908094/","name":"Paul Walker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879085/","name":"Tyrese Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0369513/","name":"Cole Hauser"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005436/","name":"John Singleton"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106989/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0860155/","name":"Gary Scott Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0322259, Title: 2 Fast 2 Furious, --- Description: 2 Fast 2 Furious: Directed by John Singleton. With Paul Walker, Tyrese Gibson, Eva Mendes, Cole Hauser. Former cop Brian O'Conner is called upon to bust a dangerous criminal and he recruits the help of a former childhood friend and street racer who has a chance to redeem himself." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0322259/","name":"2 Fast 2 Furious","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzExYjcyYWMtY2JkOC00NDUwLTg2OTgtMDI3MGY2OWQzMDE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Former cop Brian O'Conner is called upon to bust a dangerous criminal and he recruits the help of a former childhood friend and street racer who has a chance to redeem himself.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0322259/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"daniel_velker","dateCreated":"2013-05-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"2 times the fast 2 times the furious but still not better than the original.","reviewBody":"This film brings back more of what we loved from the first film with all the cars, girls, and action and multiplies it. However it is still inferior to the first film but that dosen't mean it isn't awesome. This movie has gotten a lot of criticism and i don't understand why there is so much hate for this movie. Some people complained about the lack of plot and the casts acting skills but I don't care about that. I watch these Fast films to be entertained and I was throughly entertained with this one. Even though it dosen't match up to the original it still excels in excitement. I mean how could you go wrong with taking the series to Miami were our eyes will be blessed with dozens of beautiful beach girls. And the races in this movie are also very exciting to. And let's not forget the awesome chase sequence in the film as well. Paul Walker and Tyrese Gibson make a great team and show us why this movie is so cool. I still love this movie despite the many negative reviews I've seen and to all the haters I say forget about the plot and just enjoy the perks. This movie is made for entertainment not Oscar awards and as far as entertainment goes It was grade A popcorn style.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":265332,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2003-06-06","keywords":"undercover agent,racing,miami florida,sequel,motor vehicle","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"2 Fast 2 Furious","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2897412377","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDIyZWUxZjgtMTA1ZC00YWQxLTg1NWMtMGI5MjBkMGE0MzRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDIyZWUxZjgtMTA1ZC00YWQxLTg1NWMtMGI5MjBkMGE0MzRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0908094/","name":"Paul Walker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879085/","name":"Tyrese Gibson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0369513/","name":"Cole Hauser"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005436/","name":"John Singleton"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0106989/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0860155/","name":"Gary Scott Thompson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"],"duration":"PT1H47M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dunkirk
Denkerk
programme.desc:
Dunkirk: Directed by Christopher Nolan. With Fionn Whitehead, Damien Bonnard, Aneurin Barnard, Lee Armstrong. Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Commonwealth and Empire, and France are surrounded by the German Army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5013056/","name":"Dunkirk","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2YyZjQ0NTEtNzU5MS00NGZkLTg0MTEtYzJmMWY3MWRhZjM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Commonwealth and Empire, and France are surrounded by the German Army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5013056/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MartinHafer"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"A tough, tough film to watch...and an amazing film was well.","reviewBody":"Before you decide to watch "Dunkirk" I have a bit of a warning. While you would expect death and blood in a war film, some of the scenes in the film are amazingly tough to watch. There's actually very little blood, but there are some drowning scenes which are intense and awful. Now I am not saying don't watch it...just be prepared.

The story is a retelling of the escape of the British* from the beaches of Dunkirk. The German army was coming and the combined British and French forces were trapped with little apparent chance to escape. And, as an army of over 300,000 Brits dug in and waited, the Luftwaffe began chipping away at them....and ultimately would have killed and/or captured them all if it wasn't for a rag-tag flotilla of private boats which hastily arrived and spirited away about 80-90% of the men.

By the way, early in the film you hear someone speaking to the pilot (Tom Hardy) over the radio. The voice is that of Michael Caine....an odd and brief cameo.

The story is gripping, well told and brilliant. I have only one complaint, and I am surprised it made it to the film considering how amazing a director Christopher Nolan is. At one point, the scene switches between some men in a boat being attacked and a private yacht rescuing downed pilots. The scenes kept switching back and forth....but one was clearly at night and the other clearly was in daylight. This really didn't make any sense. Still, otherwise an amazing spectacle...a truly amazing war film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":608168,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2017-07-19","keywords":"world war two,1940s,soldier,beach,evacuation","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Final Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3402283289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhMGY3YWQtMGYwZC00ZmM5LTg2MzgtZGRlNWQ2MGE2MTNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhMGY3YWQtMGYwZC00ZmM5LTg2MzgtZGRlNWQ2MGE2MTNiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7887725/","name":"Fionn Whitehead"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4422686/","name":"Barry Keoghan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0753314/","name":"Mark Rylance"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0634240/","name":"Christopher Nolan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147954/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240550/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0634240/","name":"Christopher Nolan"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Universal Soldier
Univerzalni vojnik
programme.desc:
Universal Soldier: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dolph Lundgren, Ally Walker, Ed O'Ross. Two rival soldiers who were killed in Vietnam are brought back to life in a top secret military experiment that creates superhuman warriors." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105698/","name":"Universal Soldier","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdhYjAyMmItMDA1Yi00MzczLWFiM2MtMjdhZDBhZGU3M2I5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDI4NjM1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two rival soldiers who were killed in Vietnam are brought back to life in a top secret military experiment that creates superhuman warriors.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105698/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"breakdownthatfilm-blogspot-com"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting story with a dragging plot","reviewBody":"Before films like Sylvester Stallone's The Expendables (2010) were released, most action stars performed solo. Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sylvester Stallone, Bruce Willis, Dolph Lundgren, and Jean-Claude Van Damme all made their own separate movies. Combining star power wasn't usually thought of because of how different the fan bases were. However, this movie is one those exceptions. Today it could be considered a movie where they collaborated before they were extremely well known (although at the time they were anyway). It was rare at that time to see two big names on the same screen - which probably pumped up a lot of people.

Here, Jean-Claude Van Damme and Dolph Lundgren play Luc Deveraux and Andrew Scott, two Vietnam veteran soldiers killed in the line of duty, who end up being regenerated to serve as a UniSol (short for Universal Soldier). As a UniSol, their purpose is to carry out impossible tasks that no other ordinary soldier could do. To carry out these missions, the UniSols are monitored and commanded by remote audio instructions. One day on the latest mission, Luc begins to have a relapse of old memories and begins to bug out. After disobeying an order, he runs off with reporter Veronica Roberts (Ally Walker) to find out what he missed. Close behind them is Luc's colonel with Andrew Scott 2nd in command looking to rid them of their existence.

For the majority of the running time, the plot is a big chase. Yet, in only some instances does it actually feel like a chase. Writer Dean Devlin managed to include some unique scenes but his pacing on how the story moves, plods from time to time. That's not to say the material he includes in the story isn't noteworthy. Again, this goes back to some unique scenes that Devlin included - most of which involve Andrew Scott (Lundgren). This movie is also one of the few that director Roland Emmerich did not include a political commentary on since this idea is so far fetched. However, he does mingle some themes that are still important to recognize - for example, playing the role of God. If there was the technology to actually re-animate dead tissue, would it be possible to have complete control over the body? Hard to say, the mind is a tricky thing.

However, the movie cannot be analyzed too much because throughout the story there are a lot of loopholes and questions that aren't answered - like how can someone survive a fall from an enormous height and not come back mangled or even bruised? This is one those films where it's fun to watch but cannot be taken literal because of how absurd the idea really is. The acting can be moderately dealt with. Ally Walker plays her role like any other person would. She has a few lines that'll make people chuckle but not much else. Jean-Claude Van Damme's acting is stone faced for most of the time because of how he's not familiar with the world. However, Dolph Lundgren looked like he had a great time playing his role because of how deranged his character is. It was also wise of the casting department to at least make Lundgren the antagonist because of his height. If it were the other way around, I'm not sure if the entertainment level would be as high.

What is fun to watch here, is when Lundgren and Van Damme finally clash. Since they both have martial arts training, there's no question that the kicks and fists will fly between them. Lundgren's got the bulk and Van Damme's got the agility. They both are good in contrast to each other, the only thing that was needed was Van Damme putting just a little more emotion into his role. Other than that, the cinematography and editing works well too. Finally, composing the musical score belongs to Christopher Franke who now produces music for The Amazing Race (2002) series. Franke's score does contain tunes that can be heard with light emotional tones but it's nothing too deep; which is pretty much how the film should be taken. Fun but not deep.

The action on screen between Dolph Lundgren and Jean-Claude Van Damme is fun even though it is sporadic. The story elements are interesting considering it also makes the plot drag. Look for nothing too deep here.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86900,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1992-07-10","keywords":"soldier,reporter,scientist,super soldier,top secret","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Universal Soldier","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3638559001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGNkY2E3NDgtZTc4ZS00MWYzLTk4ZTQtYzJiMjUyZGM4NWFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGNkY2E3NDgtZTc4ZS00MWYzLTk4ZTQtYzJiMjUyZGM4NWFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000241/","name":"Jean-Claude Van Damme"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000185/","name":"Dolph Lundgren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001824/","name":"Ally Walker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094459/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0149490/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745330/","name":"Richard Rothstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0500609/","name":"Christopher Leitch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002041/","name":"Dean Devlin"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0105698, Title: Universal Soldier, --- Description: Universal Soldier: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dolph Lundgren, Ally Walker, Ed O'Ross. Two rival soldiers who were killed in Vietnam are brought back to life in a top secret military experiment that creates superhuman warriors." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105698/","name":"Universal Soldier","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdhYjAyMmItMDA1Yi00MzczLWFiM2MtMjdhZDBhZGU3M2I5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDI4NjM1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two rival soldiers who were killed in Vietnam are brought back to life in a top secret military experiment that creates superhuman warriors.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105698/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"breakdownthatfilm-blogspot-com","dateCreated":"2014-05-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting story with a dragging plot","reviewBody":"Before films like Sylvester Stallone's The Expendables (2010) were released, most action stars performed solo. Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sylvester Stallone, Bruce Willis, Dolph Lundgren, and Jean-Claude Van Damme all made their own separate movies. Combining star power wasn't usually thought of because of how different the fan bases were. However, this movie is one those exceptions. Today it could be considered a movie where they collaborated before they were extremely well known (although at the time they were anyway). It was rare at that time to see two big names on the same screen - which probably pumped up a lot of people.

Here, Jean-Claude Van Damme and Dolph Lundgren play Luc Deveraux and Andrew Scott, two Vietnam veteran soldiers killed in the line of duty, who end up being regenerated to serve as a UniSol (short for Universal Soldier). As a UniSol, their purpose is to carry out impossible tasks that no other ordinary soldier could do. To carry out these missions, the UniSols are monitored and commanded by remote audio instructions. One day on the latest mission, Luc begins to have a relapse of old memories and begins to bug out. After disobeying an order, he runs off with reporter Veronica Roberts (Ally Walker) to find out what he missed. Close behind them is Luc's colonel with Andrew Scott 2nd in command looking to rid them of their existence.

For the majority of the running time, the plot is a big chase. Yet, in only some instances does it actually feel like a chase. Writer Dean Devlin managed to include some unique scenes but his pacing on how the story moves, plods from time to time. That's not to say the material he includes in the story isn't noteworthy. Again, this goes back to some unique scenes that Devlin included - most of which involve Andrew Scott (Lundgren). This movie is also one of the few that director Roland Emmerich did not include a political commentary on since this idea is so far fetched. However, he does mingle some themes that are still important to recognize - for example, playing the role of God. If there was the technology to actually re-animate dead tissue, would it be possible to have complete control over the body? Hard to say, the mind is a tricky thing.

However, the movie cannot be analyzed too much because throughout the story there are a lot of loopholes and questions that aren't answered - like how can someone survive a fall from an enormous height and not come back mangled or even bruised? This is one those films where it's fun to watch but cannot be taken literal because of how absurd the idea really is. The acting can be moderately dealt with. Ally Walker plays her role like any other person would. She has a few lines that'll make people chuckle but not much else. Jean-Claude Van Damme's acting is stone faced for most of the time because of how he's not familiar with the world. However, Dolph Lundgren looked like he had a great time playing his role because of how deranged his character is. It was also wise of the casting department to at least make Lundgren the antagonist because of his height. If it were the other way around, I'm not sure if the entertainment level would be as high.

What is fun to watch here, is when Lundgren and Van Damme finally clash. Since they both have martial arts training, there's no question that the kicks and fists will fly between them. Lundgren's got the bulk and Van Damme's got the agility. They both are good in contrast to each other, the only thing that was needed was Van Damme putting just a little more emotion into his role. Other than that, the cinematography and editing works well too. Finally, composing the musical score belongs to Christopher Franke who now produces music for The Amazing Race (2002) series. Franke's score does contain tunes that can be heard with light emotional tones but it's nothing too deep; which is pretty much how the film should be taken. Fun but not deep.

The action on screen between Dolph Lundgren and Jean-Claude Van Damme is fun even though it is sporadic. The story elements are interesting considering it also makes the plot drag. Look for nothing too deep here.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86900,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1992-07-10","keywords":"soldier,reporter,scientist,super soldier,top secret","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Universal Soldier","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3638559001","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGNkY2E3NDgtZTc4ZS00MWYzLTk4ZTQtYzJiMjUyZGM4NWFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGNkY2E3NDgtZTc4ZS00MWYzLTk4ZTQtYzJiMjUyZGM4NWFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000241/","name":"Jean-Claude Van Damme","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000185/","name":"Dolph Lundgren","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001824/","name":"Ally Walker"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094459/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0149490/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745330/","name":"Richard Rothstein","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0500609/","name":"Christopher Leitch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002041/","name":"Dean Devlin"],"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Predator
Predator
programme.desc:
Predator: Directed by John McTiernan. With Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers, Elpidia Carrillo, Bill Duke. A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0093773/","name":"Predator","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QwYmFmZTEtNzY2Mi00ZWMyLWEwY2YtMGIyNGZjMWExOWEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093773/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MacKrazy"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"It Hunts For Pleasure, It Kills For Sport...................","reviewBody":""Predator" is a genuine Classic. Action, Horror, Sci-Fi it's all there. Lets see for starters we have Arnold Schwarzenegger, on top form riding to the peak of his action status, leading a team of tough Commandos. Made up of a great cast including Carl Weathers, Jesse Ventura and Bill Duke. They're on a mission to rescue Hostages from Gorilla forces but are double crossed by the C.I.A, stop there and you already have a great action movie.

But oh no, this film also has an Intergalactic Alien Big Game hunter equipped with plasma cannons, Stealth Invisibility and Thermal Vision. It would be so easy to imagine this film going nowhere if it where to have fallen into the wrong hands. You could really imagine a plot of an Alien hunting Commandos in the jungle coming off a bit lame but no, Fox thankfully had faith and McTierman had a vision. Fox's faith may have been down to there two previous unexpected big hits "Aliens" and "Commando" which you could possibly say this film is a hybrid of.

Film also benefits from being made in that 80s early 90s era where your action film could take its self seriously yet still not too seriously. One minute we see a fairly realistic use of of weapons and tactics the next Arnie throws a truck down a hill equipped with C4 and Jesse Ventura pulls out his M-134 Mini Gun and shreds some Gorillas.

The Predator it's self is a classic design, thanks to the genius Stan Winston, and in my opinion never looked better than in this movie. It looked slightly fake in Pred 2(Not a bad film too) and don't get me started on the travesty that is AvP. It could have been a different story if they had stuck to the big rubber turtle they had shot scenes with thank god Arnold himself suggested Winston.

I won't spoil the plot for anyone who's not yet seen it I just urge you to see this movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":392105,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Horror"],"datePublished":"1987-06-12","keywords":"jungle,survival,hunting people,commando,predator","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Predator","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1686176025","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhN2FjZDYtOTExNC00N2NkLTk0M2MtMjA0ZWFmMDM3OWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhN2FjZDYtOTExNC00N2NkLTk0M2MtMjA0ZWFmMDM3OWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000216/","name":"Arnold Schwarzenegger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001835/","name":"Carl Weathers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001310/","name":"Kevin Peter Hall"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001532/","name":"John McTiernan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041635/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019968/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0859029/","name":"Jim Thomas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0859049/","name":"John Thomas"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fled
Bekstvo u lancima
programme.desc:
Fled: Directed by Kevin Hooks. With Laurence Fishburne, Stephen Baldwin, Will Patton, Robert John Burke. Two prisoners chained together flee during an escape attempt gone bad." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116320/","name":"Fled","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3N2Q4MmUtMzA5MC00ZWY1LWIxNDItYWZkOWFmZGNkNWU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two prisoners chained together flee during an escape attempt gone bad.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116320/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"barnabyrudge"},"dateCreated":"2003-01-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Actioner which borrows most of its ideas from other pictures","reviewBody":"Fled is a cheerfully illogical actioner which rattles along at a seriously rapid pace without ever pausing for breath. It's stupid and spectacular in equal measure.

The plot hardly seems important, but for what it's worth here it is: a Cuban mafia boss has foolishly allowed himself to leave some incriminating evidence on a computer disk. The only guy who knows where the whereabouts of the disk is in a chain gang in the Deep South. An undercover cop is sent to the chain gang to find out where the disk is, and to keep the guy alive when the Cuban hitmen turn up to silence him.

The first half of the movie borrows liberally from The Defiant Ones, with Baldwin and Fishburne chained together and fleeing through the swamps from both the good guys and the bad guys. Later on, they reach the big city, and the film then borrows ideas from any police actioner that you could care to mention (Lethal Weapon, The Dead Pool, Tango and Cash, Striking Distance, et al). In fact, the second half of the film consists solely of fist fights and car chases and shootouts, all inspired by similar movies from the genre.

Fled never bores you, but it never particularly engages your brain. Two prisoners chained together flee during an escape attempt gone bad." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116320/","name":"Fled","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3N2Q4MmUtMzA5MC00ZWY1LWIxNDItYWZkOWFmZGNkNWU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two prisoners chained together flee during an escape attempt gone bad.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116320/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"barnabyrudge","dateCreated":"2003-01-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Actioner which borrows most of its ideas from other pictures","reviewBody":"Fled is a cheerfully illogical actioner which rattles along at a seriously rapid pace without ever pausing for breath. It's stupid and spectacular in equal measure.

The plot hardly seems important, but for what it's worth here it is: a Cuban mafia boss has foolishly allowed himself to leave some incriminating evidence on a computer disk. The only guy who knows where the whereabouts of the disk is in a chain gang in the Deep South. An undercover cop is sent to the chain gang to find out where the disk is, and to keep the guy alive when the Cuban hitmen turn up to silence him.

The first half of the movie borrows liberally from The Defiant Ones, with Baldwin and Fishburne chained together and fleeing through the swamps from both the good guys and the bad guys. Later on, they reach the big city, and the film then borrows ideas from any police actioner that you could care to mention (Lethal Weapon, The Dead Pool, Tango and Cash, Striking Distance, et al). In fact, the second half of the film consists solely of fist fights and car chases and shootouts, all inspired by similar movies from the genre.

Fled never bores you, but it never particularly engages your brain. It is a quickly forgotten film, but it is also the perfect film to watch with your mates while you sink a six-pack of beer and a 16" pizza on a Friday night.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8949,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Crime"],"datePublished":"1996-07-19","keywords":"police chase,massage parlor,hitman,death of girlfriend,stone mountain","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1677312793","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2EyNjNjNjItY2MzMS00Zjc4LThmNmItNTdkOGM3MjMyZmFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2EyNjNjNjItY2MzMS00Zjc4LThmNmItNTdkOGM3MjMyZmFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two prisoners chained together flee during an escape attempt gone bad.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000401/","name":"Laurence Fishburne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000286/","name":"Stephen Baldwin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001599/","name":"Will Patton"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393661/","name":"Kevin Hooks"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926211/","name":"Preston A. A female pirate and her companion race against their rivals to find a hidden island that contains a fabulous treasure." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0112760/","name":"Cutthroat Island","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjg0ZjIzMDYtNmUyNS00NzQxLWFhZGQtOGYzMzE0ZWEwM2UxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDI2NDg0NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A female pirate and her companion race against their rivals to find a hidden island that contains a fabulous treasure.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0112760/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"melancholicmoon"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fun popcorn pirate movie","reviewBody":"Just take this as it is: a fun aventure film to enjoy with a big bowl of popcorn. The soundtrack is perfectly suited for it. programme.title: Predator
Predator
programme.desc:
Predator: Directed by John McTiernan. With Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers, Elpidia Carrillo, Bill Duke. A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0093773/","name":"Predator","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QwYmFmZTEtNzY2Mi00ZWMyLWEwY2YtMGIyNGZjMWExOWEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093773/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MacKrazy"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"It Hunts For Pleasure, It Kills For Sport...................","reviewBody":""Predator" is a genuine Classic. Action, Horror, Sci-Fi it's all there. Lets see for starters we have Arnold Schwarzenegger, on top form riding to the peak of his action status, leading a team of tough Commandos. Made up of a great cast including Carl Weathers, Jesse Ventura and Bill Duke. They're on a mission to rescue Hostages from Gorilla forces but are double crossed by the C.I.A, stop there and you already have a great action movie.

But oh no, this film also has an Intergalactic Alien Big Game hunter equipped with plasma cannons, Stealth Invisibility and Thermal Vision. It would be so easy to imagine this film going nowhere if it where to have fallen into the wrong hands. You could really imagine a plot of an Alien hunting Commandos in the jungle coming off a bit lame but no, Fox thankfully had faith and McTierman had a vision. Fox's faith may have been down to there two previous unexpected big hits "Aliens" and "Commando" which you could possibly say this film is a hybrid of.

Film also benefits from being made in that 80s early 90s era where your action film could take its self seriously yet still not too seriously. One minute we see a fairly realistic use of of weapons and tactics the next Arnie throws a truck down a hill equipped with C4 and Jesse Ventura pulls out his M-134 Mini Gun and shreds some Gorillas.

The Predator it's self is a classic design, thanks to the genius Stan Winston, and in my opinion never looked better than in this movie. It looked slightly fake in Pred 2(Not a bad film too) and don't get me started on the travesty that is AvP. It could have been a different story if they had stuck to the big rubber turtle they had shot scenes with thank god Arnold himself suggested Winston.

I won't spoil the plot for anyone who's not yet seen it I just urge you to see this movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":392105,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Horror"],"datePublished":"1987-06-12","keywords":"jungle,survival,hunting people,commando,predator","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Predator","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1686176025","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhN2FjZDYtOTExNC00N2NkLTk0M2MtMjA0ZWFmMDM3OWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhN2FjZDYtOTExNC00N2NkLTk0M2MtMjA0ZWFmMDM3OWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000216/","name":"Arnold Schwarzenegger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001835/","name":"Carl Weathers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001310/","name":"Kevin Peter Hall"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001532/","name":"John McTiernan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041635/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019968/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0859029/","name":"Jim Thomas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0859049/","name":"John Thomas"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Universal Soldier
Univerzalni vojnik
programme.desc:
Universal Soldier: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dolph Lundgren, Ally Walker, Ed O'Ross. Two rival soldiers who were killed in Vietnam are brought back to life in a top secret military experiment that creates superhuman warriors." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105698/","name":"Universal Soldier","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdhYjAyMmItMDA1Yi00MzczLWFiM2MtMjdhZDBhZGU3M2I5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDI4NjM1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two rival soldiers who were killed in Vietnam are brought back to life in a top secret military experiment that creates superhuman warriors.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105698/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"breakdownthatfilm-blogspot-com"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting story with a dragging plot","reviewBody":"Before films like Sylvester Stallone's The Expendables (2010) were released, most action stars performed solo. Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sylvester Stallone, Bruce Willis, Dolph Lundgren, and Jean-Claude Van Damme all made their own separate movies. Combining star power wasn't usually thought of because of how different the fan bases were. However, this movie is one those exceptions. Today it could be considered a movie where they collaborated before they were extremely well known (although at the time they were anyway). It was rare at that time to see two big names on the same screen - which probably pumped up a lot of people.

Here, Jean-Claude Van Damme and Dolph Lundgren play Luc Deveraux and Andrew Scott, two Vietnam veteran soldiers killed in the line of duty, who end up being regenerated to serve as a UniSol (short for Universal Soldier). As a UniSol, their purpose is to carry out impossible tasks that no other ordinary soldier could do. To carry out these missions, the UniSols are monitored and commanded by remote audio instructions. One day on the latest mission, Luc begins to have a relapse of old memories and begins to bug out. After disobeying an order, he runs off with reporter Veronica Roberts (Ally Walker) to find out what he missed. Close behind them is Luc's colonel with Andrew Scott 2nd in command looking to rid them of their existence.

For the majority of the running time, the plot is a big chase. Yet, in only some instances does it actually feel like a chase. Writer Dean Devlin managed to include some unique scenes but his pacing on how the story moves, plods from time to time. That's not to say the material he includes in the story isn't noteworthy. Again, this goes back to some unique scenes that Devlin included - most of which involve Andrew Scott (Lundgren). This movie is also one of the few that director Roland Emmerich did not include a political commentary on since this idea is so far fetched. However, he does mingle some themes that are still important to recognize - for example, playing the role of God. If there was the technology to actually re-animate dead tissue, would it be possible to have complete control over the body? Hard to say, the mind is a tricky thing.

However, the movie cannot be analyzed too much because throughout the story there are a lot of loopholes and questions that aren't answered - like how can someone survive a fall from an enormous height and not come back mangled or even bruised? This is one those films where it's fun to watch but cannot be taken literal because of how absurd the idea really is. The acting can be moderately dealt with. Ally Walker plays her role like any other person would. She has a few lines that'll make people chuckle but not much else. Jean-Claude Van Damme's acting is stone faced for most of the time because of how he's not familiar with the world. However, Dolph Lundgren looked like he had a great time playing his role because of how deranged his character is. It was also wise of the casting department to at least make Lundgren the antagonist because of his height. If it were the other way around, I'm not sure if the entertainment level would be as high.

What is fun to watch here, is when Lundgren and Van Damme finally clash. Since they both have martial arts training, there's no question that the kicks and fists will fly between them. Lundgren's got the bulk and Van Damme's got the agility. They both are good in contrast to each other, the only thing that was needed was Van Damme putting just a little more emotion into his role. Other than that, the cinematography and editing works well too. Finally, composing the musical score belongs to Christopher Franke who now produces music for The Amazing Race (2002) series. Franke's score does contain tunes that can be heard with light emotional tones but it's nothing too deep; which is pretty much how the film should be taken. Fun but not deep.

The action on screen between Dolph Lundgren and Jean-Claude Van Damme is fun even though it is sporadic. The story elements are interesting considering it also makes the plot drag. IMDb data; ttnr: 0105698, Title: Universal Soldier, --- Description: Universal Soldier: Directed by Roland Emmerich. With Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dolph Lundgren, Ally Walker, Ed O'Ross. Two rival soldiers who were killed in Vietnam are brought back to life in a top secret military experiment that creates superhuman warriors." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105698/","name":"Universal Soldier","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdhYjAyMmItMDA1Yi00MzczLWFiM2MtMjdhZDBhZGU3M2I5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDI4NjM1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two rival soldiers who were killed in Vietnam are brought back to life in a top secret military experiment that creates superhuman warriors.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105698/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"breakdownthatfilm-blogspot-com","dateCreated":"2014-05-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesting story with a dragging plot","reviewBody":"Before films like Sylvester Stallone's The Expendables (2010) were released, most action stars performed solo. Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sylvester Stallone, Bruce Willis, Dolph Lundgren, and Jean-Claude Van Damme all made their own separate movies. Combining star power wasn't usually thought of because of how different the fan bases were. However, this movie is one those exceptions. Today it could be considered a movie where they collaborated before they were extremely well known (although at the time they were anyway). It was rare at that time to see two big names on the same screen - which probably pumped up a lot of people.

Here, Jean-Claude Van Damme and Dolph Lundgren play Luc Deveraux and Andrew Scott, two Vietnam veteran soldiers killed in the line of duty, who end up being regenerated to serve as a UniSol (short for Universal Soldier). As a UniSol, their purpose is to carry out impossible tasks that no other ordinary soldier could do. To carry out these missions, the UniSols are monitored and commanded by remote audio instructions. One day on the latest mission, Luc begins to have a relapse of old memories and begins to bug out. After disobeying an order, he runs off with reporter Veronica Roberts (Ally Walker) to find out what he missed. Close behind them is Luc's colonel with Andrew Scott 2nd in command looking to rid them of their existence.

For the majority of the running time, the plot is a big chase. Yet, in only some instances does it actually feel like a chase. Writer Dean Devlin managed to include some unique scenes but his pacing on how the story moves, plods from time to time. That's not to say the material he includes in the story isn't noteworthy. Again, this goes back to some unique scenes that Devlin included - most of which involve Andrew Scott (Lundgren). This movie is also one of the few that director Roland Emmerich did not include a political commentary on since this idea is so far fetched. However, he does mingle some themes that are still important to recognize - for example, playing the role of God. If there was the technology to actually re-animate dead tissue, would it be possible to have complete control over the body? Hard to say, the mind is a tricky thing.

However, the movie cannot be analyzed too much because throughout the story there are a lot of loopholes and questions that aren't answered - like how can someone survive a fall from an enormous height and not come back mangled or even bruised? This is one those films where it's fun to watch but cannot be taken literal because of how absurd the idea really is. The acting can be moderately dealt with. Ally Walker plays her role like any other person would. She has a few lines that'll make people chuckle but not much else. Jean-Claude Van Damme's acting is stone faced for most of the time because of how he's not familiar with the world. However, Dolph Lundgren looked like he had a great time playing his role because of how deranged his character is. It was also wise of the casting department to at least make Lundgren the antagonist because of his height. If it were the other way around, I'm not sure if the entertainment level would be as high.

What is fun to watch here, is when Lundgren and Van Damme finally clash. Since they both have martial arts training, there's no question that the kicks and fists will fly between them. Lundgren's got the bulk and Van Damme's got the agility. They both are good in contrast to each other, the only thing that was needed was Van Damme putting just a little more emotion into his role. Other than that, the cinematography and editing works well too. Finally, composing the musical score belongs to Christopher Franke who now produces music for The Amazing Race (2002) series. Franke's score does contain tunes that can be heard with light emotional tones but it's nothing too deep; which is pretty much how the film should be taken. Fun but not deep.

The action on screen between Dolph Lundgren and Jean-Claude Van Damme is fun even though it is sporadic. The story elements are interesting considering it also makes the plot drag. Look for nothing too deep here.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86900,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1992-07-10","keywords":"soldier,reporter,scientist,super soldier,top secret","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Universal Soldier","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3638559001","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGNkY2E3NDgtZTc4ZS00MWYzLTk4ZTQtYzJiMjUyZGM4NWFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGNkY2E3NDgtZTc4ZS00MWYzLTk4ZTQtYzJiMjUyZGM4NWFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000241/","name":"Jean-Claude Van Damme","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000185/","name":"Dolph Lundgren","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001824/","name":"Ally Walker"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000386/","name":"Roland Emmerich"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0094459/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0149490/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745330/","name":"Richard Rothstein","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0500609/","name":"Christopher Leitch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002041/","name":"Dean Devlin"],"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Holiday
Ljubav i praznici
programme.desc:
The Holiday: Directed by Nancy Meyers. With Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jude Law, Jack Black. Two women troubled with guy-problems swap homes in each other's countries, where they each meet a local guy and fall in love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0457939/","name":"The Holiday","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI1MDk4MzA2OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjQ3NDc3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two women troubled with guy-problems swap homes in each other's countries, where they each meet a local guy and fall in love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0457939/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Redriter"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice~ very nice","reviewBody":"This was a really good, light hearted movie, with GREAT characterization. There are points where the movie is a little slow, but not slow enough to loose your interest.

All of the characters are wonderfully developed especially Jude Laws-the under-story of Jude's character adds an extra dimension to his character and really makes you love him all the more.

Kate Winslet's character is another that was well worked out. She helps out this little old man . . . and the character development between her and this older gentleman is wonderful . . . it adds so much to her character, makes her more human, more real, someone very likable and someone you want to end up with a good ending.

Jack Black's character was sweet, not corny . . . and you end up liking him very much. He was not a goober like he usually is in his movies.

Over all, it was a wonderfully character driven movie, that was enjoyable and had you leaving the theater feeling good. I recommend it highly!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":272438,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-12-13","keywords":"kiss,film composer,english countryside,cottage,book editor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Holiday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3321037081","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWUzMGJkZjEtYTRkYS00ZTcwLWI2YTUtYTA0YjlhYTBhMzQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"duration":"PT2H16M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Romeo + Juliet
Romeo i Julija
programme.desc: Romeo + Juliet: Directed by Baz Luhrmann. With Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes, John Leguizamo, Harold Perrineau. Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117509/","name":"Romeo + Juliet","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGU4YmI1ZGQtZjExYi00M2E0LTgyYTAtNzQ5ZmVlMTk4NzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117509/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"neon47"},"dateCreated":"2005-06-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Moderized Without Losing the Shakespeare","reviewBody":"I'm a sucker for William Shakespeare even though I like it done better in the theatre. This one however, kept my attention and seemed to do a great job with modernizing the whole quarreling families thing. The movie kicks off with a street brawl between the Montegues and Capulets. The Prince forewarns them that if they ever disturb the peace again their "lives will pay the forfeit of the peace." We are then introduced to the character Romeo who is played by Leonardo DeCaprio. Leo does a great job as Romeo, but that's because Leo is a good actor in this film. Soon after that we are introduced to Juliet who is played by the beautiful Claire Danes, someone I haven't seen in too many movies. Danes does a great job playing the flirty Juliet. The movie follows the original script very accurately. The symbolism is also used very well throughout the movie. If you look at the guns you'll notice that some say sword, some say rapier, and I believe some say dagger. The Montegues always wear a Hawaiian style shirt. The Capulets dress more like mobsters or thugs even though both sides could be viewed as thugs in some sort or another. In either case each family wears a certain kind of clothing that makes it easy to tell who's who. One great part I absolutely love is the party. Juliet wears angel wings and Romeo wears a knight outfit. Romeo's best friend (and I wish I could spell his name but I'd rather not butcher it) dresses up as a women. So to explain this form of symbolics, for those who aren't getting it, it's Romeo is the "knight in shinning armor," Juliet is the angel of Romeo's dreams, and Romeo's best friend is the comic relief. There's other things you'll notice at the party also, like Tybalt wears devil horns(i.e. he's a villain). Both families you'll also notice are rich, which also follows the script accurately. Overall, if you're a Shakespeare fan, a fan of romantic movies, a fan of tragic movies, or a fan of artistic movies then make sure to look into this one. It'll sweep you off you're feet, make you laugh, make you cry, and make you fall in love.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":220597,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1996-11-01","keywords":"love,gangster,female nudity,sex scene,suicide","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Romeo + Juliet","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi58720537","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDU1OTJjMTItN2I4OC00ZDI2LWFhMDktNjYwN2Q3NjRmN2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDU1OTJjMTItN2I4OC00ZDI2LWFhMDktNjYwN2Q3NjRmN2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000138/","name":"Leonardo DiCaprio"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000491/","name":"John Leguizamo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062619/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0091365/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000636/","name":"William Shakespeare"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668902/","name":"Craig Pearce"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525303/","name":"Baz Luhrmann"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="
